page.title: 01Voe
page.content: Voe is a picturesque village positioned at the north end of the Shetland mainland.It gets its name from its situation around a voe or deep water inlet. The land in Voe is mainly rough grazing with only a few trees planted at Lower Voe. The absence of trees is due to our windy climate and the salt sea spray. Voe is 10 miles south of Sullom Voe where the oil terminal is sited. The construction of the Sullom Voe Oil Terminal in the 1970's resulted in many changes to the local community. Employment was provided for some local people,main roads were improved and widened and more houses were built in the area.
